page.title: 10A Working Day At Tannadice.
page.content: A Typical Day At Balmadity Farm. My dad and I get up at 6:30 a.m. and have our breakfast.At 7:0 a.m. after waking up Mum, we have to begin work. First we feed the animals.The calves are all kept in one field and are fed with barley.Then we feed the sheep which are kept in an other field.My father uses an electric fence to keep the sheep in and one of my jobs is to use the tester to make sure it is working.We then feed the young calves in the barn.Then we go to Shandford Farm which belongs to my Grandpa.There I help my uncle Graeme herd the cows and sheep.We don't give our calves names, there are too many. Each calf has a number and we weigh each calf and write it's weight down in the book beside it's number to check that it is growing properly.It is hard work on the farm and I'm tired by teatime.
